name: Mosaic City Hotel

reviews.text: You wander off of the dusty highway and even dustier Madaba streets into an absolutely spotless hotel. We were amazed at how clean it was. Our room was ready on arrival and our daughter's crib all set up ( a pack and play). The hotel put us in the very back on the hotel, and off of the street without us even asking so the street noise wouldn't wake up our toddler (something US hotels still can't seem to get correct).
reviews.title: EXCEPTIONALLY clean, great location

reviews.text: The bed was HUGE, we had a little balcony, and the soap dish was in a Mosiac of the hotel name. We were spoilt for TV with ton of choices and our daughter really enjoyed the arabic music videos while we got ready in the morning. We were able to visit the Bethany Beyond the Jordan site and the Dead Sea easily as a day trip from the hotel. You can walk to the Mosaics from the hotel ( maybe a 3-5 minute walk), all the tourist shops and restaurants from the hotel,ad there's a free parking lot around the side of the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect! Close to Amman (Queen Alia Airport), Mt Nebo, River Jordan and Red Sea for day visits

reviews.text: We expected breakfast to be rather sparse since it was the low season, but we pleasantly surprised at the spread each morning- fruit juice, breads with homemade jam, meats, cheeses, hummus/ lebnah/ other Jordanian breakfast specialities, and an assortment of morning pastries from the bakeries. They also had two IKEA highchairs!
reviews.title: Whether for stop-over (Queen Alia) or for the mosaics

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Again and again

reviews.text: **NOTE**: If you are using the Bradt guide or the Rough Guide, the maps are inadequate for finding the hotel if you are coming from the airport. You enter on a roundabout that's not on either guidebook map, so try to map out the directions before you arrive as the streetsigns are SUPER tiny to see. Thankfully my husband speaks arabic so it only took a little while to figure out we were off the maps.
reviews.title: Bit of a rip-off

reviews.text: This hotel appears newly renovated, and clean as a pin. Family run and very hospitable. Hair dryers are not available in the room, but a quick call to the front desk, and they deliver one. Our room had a balcony overlooking the city. Wine and refreshments in room available for purchase at moderate prices. We had dinner in the hotel dining room...10JD well worth it. Food was delicous and the owner/chef walked around during dinner to check on all guest. Buffet hot breakfast included, excellent was to start the day. Hotel offered free parking. Good location.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Mosaic City Hotel for 3 nights in mid April. This is an excellent hotel and highly recommended. The hotel is modern and clean. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Upon my request, the hotel provided a driver for me and my wife Mr. Fakhrey Abu Saeed.Fakhrey was our driver for the entire time we were in Jordan (7 days). Fakhrey was prompt, courteous, and professional. More importantly, he is a safe driver. He is very familiar with the roads in Jordan that we were efficient in our sightseeing since we were able to maximize on the sights we were visiting per day. On the way to Petra, we stopped by MT. Nebo, Baptism site, and Shobak castle; all in one day. He also took us to places to eat that were reasonably price and delicious. Highly recommended driver in Jordan! Mr. Fakhrey Abu Saeed: fakhrey2002@hotmail.com
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started our trip in Madaba and decided to end up here too as its so close to the airport. We stayed at the Mariam first time and so wanted to try somewhere different.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would say of all the places we stayed in Jordan, this was the best in its price range.
reviews.title: Perfect start point in a fabulous country

reviews.text: positive points - the location is perfect for sightseeing, being only minutes from the main sites. The hotel itself is light, airy, and very clean. Our room was large with a king size bed. All very light and modern. We had a quiet balcony which we really appreciated. Most if not all rooms seem to have one. The shower was also excellent.
reviews.title: nice place very clean and centrally located

reviews.text: Great hotel , very modern, clean, rooms very comfortable and spacious, clean modern bathrooms, internet worked, balcony, was a nice surprise as we needed a good place to have a good rest.
reviews.title: Modern clean and confortable hotel in centre of Madaba

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok.
reviews.title: Very good!

reviews.text: The staff recommended a restaurant called Adonis, around 15 min walk, which turned out to be the best jordanian food of the whole trip. Not cheap tho.
reviews.title: Pleasent surprise

reviews.text: Perfect. The roomes seems to be recently renovated completely in a modern and nice touch. Huge beds, great staff and service. Quite. The Internet is very fast! Completely adapted to the modern traveller.
reviews.title: Excllent Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is a pleasent surprise. Arrived in Jordan unsure what to expect from a budget hotel. The rooms were really spacious, clean with lovely mosaics dotted around. If you are planning on staying in madaba, this is a good place to stay.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: We only spent one night in this hotel but it was very clean, spacious and friendly. We would definitely stay there again. We travelled with two children aged 13 and 10 and had a triple room with a huge king sized bed and a single bed for the four of us and this was perfectly adequate. We had an early start for the airport and although breakfast doesn’t start until 7am they got cake and coffee for us at 6am which helped start our long day! Incidentally, the airport is only about a 30 minute drive away.
reviews.title: Probably the best hotel in Madaba

reviews.text: Eat at least once at the falafel bar next door to the hotel. It is on the corner of the narrow road immediately to the left of the hotel and had the best falafel we ate on the whole trip. The guys in there were very friendly and the four of us ate and drank well for only 6JD!
reviews.title: Fantastic little hotel in the centre of town

reviews.text: We had read the reviews on this hotel and were confident that it would be good but it was still better than we expected. The rooms are great and comfortable and the location is within walking distance of the towns attractions.
reviews.title: A Great Spot

reviews.text: Outstanding value. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: A lovely surprise

reviews.text: Our stay at this hotel was a chance one and it seems we made a good choice. The location right in the main part of town with plenty of food places and sights within an easy walking distance. We stayed several nights here as we enjoyed the town, the ease of check in and the great rooms.
reviews.title: Great mid range hotel

description: The Mosaic City Hotel is an intimate hotel that makes you feel right at home. The hotel has 50 rooms and is located in the very heart of Madaba, within short walking distance from the Church of St. George which houses the famous mosaic map of the Holy Land.
